hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbade storing the meat of sacrifices beyond three days, and forbade fermentation in gourds, hollowed wood, watered skins, and jars. He also forbade us from visiting graves. He said: Oh people, I had forbidden you from storing the meat of sacrifices beyond three days because of the poverty of Muslims so you would share among yourselves, but Allah has expanded for you, so eat, feed others, and store. I forbade you from fermentation in gourds, hollowed wood, watered skins, and jars, for a vessel does not make something permissible or impermissible, but avoid intoxicants. I forbade you from visiting graves because the disbelievers would go to them and cling to them, sacrificing near them and speaking foolishness. So do not do as they do, but there is no harm in visiting them, for in visiting them is an admonishment as long as you do not speak foolishness.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: A shepherd came to the Prophet ﷺ carrying a roasted rabbit. The Prophet ﷺ asked him: Is this a gift or charity? He said: O Messenger of Allah, it is a gift. When the rabbit was presented to the Prophet ﷺ, he looked at it and saw blood in it. The Prophet ﷺ then asked the people: Do you not see what I see? They replied: Yes, O Messenger of Allah, there is a trace of blood. The Prophet ﷺ said: It is for you. The people asked: Will you not eat it, O Messenger of Allah? He said: Yes. He left it out of disgust. The people then ate it. The shepherd asked: O Messenger of Allah, what do you think about eating the monitor lizard? The Prophet ﷺ said: We do not eat, and we do not give as gifts what we do not eat. The shepherd said: O Messenger of Allah, I am herding my family's sheep and I am afraid the wild animal might escape me and I do not have a knife. Can I slaughter with my tooth? He said: No. With my claw? He said: No. With a bone? He said: No. With a stick? He said: No. The shepherd asked: Then with what, O Messenger of Allah? The Prophet ﷺ said: With a flint stone, striking one against the other. If you make a cut, eat. If you do not make a cut, do not eat. The shepherd said: O Messenger of Allah, I shoot with an arrow and sometimes hit (clearly killing) and sometimes miss (wounding only). The Prophet ﷺ said: What you clearly kill, eat. What you only wound, do not eat. Abu Khalid explained that Zayd ibn Ali clarified that 'what clearly kills' means what you see with your own eyes, and 'what only wounds' means what escapes your sight, perhaps another arrow helped kill it.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: When the Prophet ﷺ completed the prayer of the Day of Sacrifice, an Ansari man met him and said: O Messenger of Allah, honor me today with your presence. The Prophet ﷺ asked: What is that? The man replied: I ordered my sacrifice to be slaughtered before I left. I wanted to begin with you, O Messenger of Allah. The Prophet ﷺ said: Your sheep is just meat. The man said: O Messenger of Allah, I have a young goat that is one year old. The Prophet ﷺ said: Slaughter it, and there is no dispensation for anyone after you. The Prophet ﷺ said: The yearling from sheep, if fat and sound, is permissible. The two-year-old from goats is permissible.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: Men from Tayy asked the Prophet ﷺ about hunting with dogs and birds of prey and what was lawful and what was forbidden for them. Allah revealed: They ask you what is lawful for them. Say: The good things are lawful for you, and what you have trained of hunting animals, teaching them from what Allah has taught you, so eat of what they catch for you and mention Allah's name upon it. And Zayd ibn Ali said: Game from untrained dogs, leopards, hawks, and falcons is not eaten except what you catch it alive, because Allah said: Eat of what they catch for you. So Allah has only made lawful what you have trained of birds of prey. Training a dog and leopard is that they do not eat, and training a hawk and falcon is that they respond when called.

hadiths.english_translation: Chapter heading: Islamic understanding before engaging in trade

potential_issues.issue: Chapter header only
potential_issues.impact: Not an actual hadith

hadiths.IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Chapter heading on requirements for traders

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: A man came to him saying: O Commander of the Believers, I want to engage in trade, please pray for me. Ali said: Have you gained understanding in the religion of Allah? The man replied: Perhaps some of it. Ali said: Woe to you, understanding first, then trade. Whoever buys and sells without asking about what is lawful and what is forbidden drowns in riba, and then drowns again.

potential_issues.issue: Chapter header only
potential_issues.impact: Not an actual hadith

hadiths.IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Chapter heading on craftspeople and artisans

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali: A man came to the Prophet ﷺ and asked: O Messenger of Allah, which earning is the best? The Prophet ﷺ said: A man's work with his own hands, and every honest transaction. Allah loves the believing craftsman. Whoever works hard for his family is like one who fights in the path of Allah.
